mdRecord.dcterms:title: A sketch of the environs of Charlestown in South Carolina
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Des Barres, Joseph F. W. (Joseph Frederick Wallet), 1729-1824
Sproule, George, 1741-1817
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Version of the map with statement of responsibility "By Captain Geo. Sproule, Assistant Engineer on the Spot" and imprint date removed, and with the table key expanded to A-L and a-k; uncolored; on Bates paper.
For a description of the variants of this map, see National Maritime Museum Collections Online, entry HNS 163.
From: J.F.W. Des Barres. Atlantic Neptune.
Relief shown by hachures; depths by soundings.
Shows positions of British units involved in the 1780 attack on Charleston.
Table of references identifies movements and major positions.
Shows coastal area from Spencers Inlet southwestward to Edisto Island.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Charleston County (S.C.)--Maps--Early works to 1800.
